Ich weiß, was man gegen diese Ausführungen einwenden wird. - Man wird sagen, der hier geschilderte Charakter der Menschen- massen, der die Unerläßlichkeit des Zwanges zur Kulturarbeit be- weisen sol, ist selbst nur die Folge fehlerhafter kultureller Ein- richtungen, durch dei die Menschen erbittert, rachsüchtig, unzu- gänglich geworden sind. Neue Generationen, liebevoll und zur Hoch- schätzung des Denkens erzogen, die frühzeitig die Wohltaten der Kultur erfahren haben, werden auch ein anderes Verhältnis zu ihr haben, sie als ihr eigenstes Besitztum empfinden, bereit sein, die

and therefore it seems necessary that they are independent of the masses through the disposal of power resources. To put it briefly,
there are two widespread human characteristics that are responsible for the fact that cultural institutions can only
be maintained by a certain degree of compulsion, namely, that they are spontaneously unwilling to work, and that arguments can do nothing against
their passions.
I know what will be objected to these remarks. - They will say that the character of the masses described here, which proves the indispensability of the compulsion to engage in cultural work, is itself only the result of faulty cultural institutions, which have made people bitter, vindictive and inadequate. New generations, lovingly brought up to value thought, who have experienced the benefits of culture at an early age, will also have a different relationship to it, will feel it to be their own possession, will be prepared to
